meanings.definition: To surpass in smoking or smoking ability.
meanings.sent1: He always manages to outsmoke his friends during their smoking breaks.
meanings.sent2: She outsmoked everyone at the barbecue with her impressive grilling skills.
meanings.sent3: The little dragon tried to outsmoke the older dragons, but they just laughed at his tiny puffs.
meanings.sent4: In the smoking competition, he outsmoked his opponents with his steady hand and precise technique.
meanings.sent5: The chimney of the old house seemed to outsmoke all the other chimneys in the neighborhood, billowing smoke into the sky.

meanings.definition: To defeat or outwit through smoking or smoking-related tactics.
meanings.sent1: The detective was able to outsmoke the criminal by following the trail of cigarette butts.
meanings.sent2: She outsmoked her opponent in the poker game by bluffing her way to victory.
meanings.sent3: The clever cat outsmoked the dog by hiding in the smoky barbecue pit, escaping its chase.
meanings.sent4: The cunning fox outsmoked the hunters by leading them through a dense smoke cloud, disappearing into the forest.
meanings.sent5: The spy outsmoked the enemy agents by using smoke grenades to create confusion and slip away unnoticed.
